DOC.HEADLINE: Chongqing gang crackdown to continue: official

TEXT.P: The gang crackdown in Chongqing would continue for a long time with hundreds of murder cases being unsolved, said Bo Xilai, Party chief of the southwestern Chinese municipality on Saturday.

Police in Chongqing had to crack another existing 500-600 murder cases although they have solved more than 500 such cases last year, said Bo, secretary of the Chongqing municipal committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC).
"I am very satisfied with the work of our law enforcement authorities," he said.
However, he said "it is still too early to review the achievements."
A sweeping crackdown against organized crimes was started in June last year in Chongqing, which lead to the arrest of 3,348 suspects as of Feb. 24.
